page.title: 16Old Railway
page.content: The old railway has been there for many years. There was a bridge over the river but the tracks were lifted twenty years ago and the bridge was pulled down. You can see where it was because the legs are still there. The river is about 1 metre deep in May. When the new Castle-Douglas by-pass is built there will be a new bridge here. We saw the marked posts beside the river, and a pile of things like cookers, fridges, old beds, cans and lots more things like that. A van comes about once a month to take things away so that they can get burnt.
